<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Advance the offset pointer enough bytes to align to 32-byte records for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// basic mode logs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">    OffsetPtr += 8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error/#a4dfd0813c3d0e0a30439b5a3e9196b59">Error::success</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Reads a log in FDR mode for version 1 of this binary format. FDR mode is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// defined as part of the compiler-rt project in xray&#95;fdr&#95;logging.h, and such</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a log consists of the familiar 32 bit XRayHeader, followed by sequences of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of interspersed 16 byte Metadata Records and 8 byte Function Records.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The following is an attempt to document the grammar of the format, which is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// parsed by this function for little-endian machines. Since the format makes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// use of BitFields, when we support big-endian architectures, we will need to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// adjust not only the endianness parameter to llvm&#39;s RecordExtractor, but also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the bit twiddling logic, which is consistent with the little-endian</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// convention that BitFields within a struct will first be packed into the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// least significant bits the address they belong to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We expect a format complying with the grammar in the following pseudo-EBNF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in Version 1 of the FDR log.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FDRLog: XRayFileHeader ThreadBuffer&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// XRayFileHeader: 32 bytes to identify the log as FDR with machine metadata.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Includes BufferSize</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ThreadBuffer: NewBuffer WallClockTime NewCPUId FunctionSequence EOB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BufSize: 8 byte unsigned integer indicating how large the buffer is.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NewBuffer: 16 byte metadata record with Thread Id.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// WallClockTime: 16 byte metadata record with human readable time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Pid: 16 byte metadata record with Pid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NewCPUId: 16 byte metadata record with CPUId and a 64 bit TSC reading.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// EOB: 16 byte record in a thread buffer plus mem garbage to fill BufSize.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FunctionSequence: NewCPUId | TSCWrap | FunctionRecord</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TSCWrap: 16 byte metadata record with a full 64 bit TSC reading.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FunctionRecord: 8 byte record with FunctionId, entry/exit, and TSC delta.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In Version 2, we make the following changes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ThreadBuffer: BufferExtents NewBuffer WallClockTime NewCPUId</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///               FunctionSequence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BufferExtents: 16 byte metdata record describing how many usable bytes are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                in the buffer. This is measured from the start of the buffer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                and must always be at least 48 (bytes).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In Version 3, we make the following changes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ThreadBuffer: BufferExtents NewBuffer WallClockTime Pid NewCPUId</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///               FunctionSequence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// EOB: &#42;deprecated&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In Version 4, we make the following changes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CustomEventRecord now includes the CPU data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In Version 5, we make the following changes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CustomEventRecord and TypedEventRecord now use TSC delta encoding similar to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// what FunctionRecord instances use, and we no longer need to include the CPU</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// id in the CustomEventRecord.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-trace-cpp-/#a6b4f89ac434c992939934e78f19cd33e"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-trace-cpp-/#a6b4f89ac434c992939934e78f19cd33e">loadFDRLog</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsLittleEndian,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlight">                 <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/xray/xrayfileheader">XRayFileHeader</a> &amp;FileHeader, std::vector&lt;XRayRecord&gt; &amp;Records) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>.size() &lt; 32)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4d2fd926089a58d482fb67a362e11bad">createStringError</a>(std::make&#95;error&#95;code(std::errc::invalid&#95;argument),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Not enough bytes for an XRay FDR log.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor">DataExtractor</a> DE(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>, IsLittleEndian, 8);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t OffsetPtr = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FileHeaderOrError = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/xray/#a204ed5f5be7dc0399e00cf74d6295a5e">readBinaryFormatHeader</a>(DE, OffsetPtr);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!FileHeaderOrError)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FileHeaderOrError.takeError();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FileHeader = std::move(FileHeaderOrError.get());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// First we load the records into memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;Record&gt;&gt; FDRRecords;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/xray/filebasedrecordproducer">FileBasedRecordProducer</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>(FileHeader, DE, OffsetPtr);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/xray/logbuilderconsumer">LogBuilderConsumer</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>(FDRRecords);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/#ad7e3a2f9134fa59a38cc0a86acaaf351">isValidOffsetForDataOfSize</a>(OffsetPtr, 1)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!R)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> E = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>.consume(std::move(R.get())))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> E;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is now the meat of the algorithm. Here we sort the blocks according to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the Walltime record in each of the blocks for the same thread. This allows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// us to more consistently recreate the execution trace in temporal order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// After the sort, we then reconstitute &#96;Trace&#96; records using a stateful</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// visitor associated with a single process+thread pair.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;Blocks = PTB.second;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (L.WallclockTime-&gt;seconds() &lt; R.WallclockTime-&gt;seconds() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-trace-cpp-/#a7782cd0e983ec47c2ebde56b05575ecb"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-trace-cpp-/#a7782cd0e983ec47c2ebde56b05575ecb">loadYAMLLog</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/xray/xrayfileheader">XRayFileHeader</a> &amp;FileHeader,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/xray/#a170f5d8b013bd6c97daa83c36c7b4c82"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;Trace&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/xray/#a170f5d8b013bd6c97daa83c36c7b4c82">llvm::xray::loadTrace</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor">DataExtractor</a> &amp;DE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Sort) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to detect the file type using file magic. We have a slight bias</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// towards the binary format, and we do this by making sure that the first 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bytes of the binary file is some combination of the following byte</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// patterns: (observe the code loading them assumes they&#39;re little endian)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   1 0 0 0 - version 1, &quot;naive&quot; format</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   1 0 1 0 - version 1, &quot;flight data recorder&quot; format</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   2 0 1 0 - version 2, &quot;flight data recorder&quot; format</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// YAML files don&#39;t typically have those first four bytes as valid text so we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// try loading assuming YAML if we don&#39;t find these bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Only if we can&#39;t load either the binary or the YAML format will we yield an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor">DataExtractor</a> HeaderExtractor(DE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/#a882aa042b8549998c9ae43305a79d955">getData</a>(), DE.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dataextractor/#ad9617bd42a629b75a6804af2cbcddddf">isLittleEndian</a>(), 8);</span></CodeLine>
